translations.en: Counting Song Intro
Upbeat track to anchor the counting warm-up.
Audio of children counting to a steady beat.
Ten-Frame Template
Printable ten-frame for composing teen numbers.
Blank ten-frame with two rows of five boxes.
Shape Sorting Demo
Teacher models sorting 2D and 3D shapes using sentence frames.
Video of a teacher grouping cones, cubes, and spheres.
Place Value Tiles
Drag-and-drop base-ten blocks for two-digit numbers.
Interactive base-ten blocks showing tens rods and ones cubes.
Time-Telling Story
Narrated story practicing reading clocks to the half hour.
Audio story describing a child reading clocks.
Data Chart Template
Printable tally and bar graph chart for class surveys.
Printable chart with tally and bar graph sections.
Count to 100 by ones and tens.
Understand the relationship between numbers and quantities.
Represent addition and subtraction with objects.
Decompose numbers less than or equal to 10.
Compose and decompose numbers 11 to 19.
Describe measurable attributes of objects.
Classify objects and count the number in each category.
Describe objects in the environment using names of shapes.
Correctly name shapes regardless of their orientations or size.
Use addition and subtraction within 20.
Apply properties of operations as strategies.
Count to 120 starting at any number less than 120.
Understand that the two digits of a two-digit number represent tens and ones.
Order three objects by length.
Tell and write time in hours and half-hours.
Organize, represent, and interpret data with up to three categories.
Distinguish between defining and non-defining attributes.
Compose two-dimensional or three-dimensional shapes.
Count to 20
Orally count forward beginning with any number within 20.
Write Numerals 0‚Äì20
Match quantities to written numerals up to 20.
Compare Sets
Use greater than, less than, and equal to when comparing.
Join and Separate
Model joining and separating with counters and drawings.
Equations Within 10
Solve addition and subtraction within 10 using equations.
Decompose 10
Break apart numbers up to 10 into two addends.
Build Teen Numbers
Compose teen numbers as ten and some ones.
Teen Number Equations
Connect ten-frame models to equations like 14 = 10 + 4.
Describe Attributes
Use math language to describe length and weight.
Sort and Classify
Classify objects and count each category.
Name Shapes
Identify and describe 2D and 3D shapes.
Compose Shapes
Build larger shapes from smaller ones.
Strategies Within 20
Use make-ten, doubles, and count-on strategies.
Unknown Addends
Find missing partners in addition and subtraction.
Count to 120
Read and write numbers to 120 starting at any number.
Compare Two-Digit Numbers
Use tens and ones to compare numbers.
Add Within 100
Add two-digit numbers using place value strategies.
Measure Lengths
Use same-size units to measure and compare.
Tell Time to the Half Hour
Read analog clocks to the hour and half hour.
Represent Data
Collect, organize, and interpret data with three categories.
Describe Shape Attributes
Identify defining attributes of 2D shapes.
Partition Shapes
Partition circles and rectangles into equal shares.
Counting & Cardinality
Build flexible counting skills and compare quantities.
Operations & Algebraic Thinking
Represent joining and separating situations with equations.
Number & Operations in Base Ten
Compose teen numbers as a ten and some ones.
Measurement & Data
Use measurable attributes to describe and sort objects.
Geometry
Name, describe, and build shapes in the world.
Operations & Algebraic Thinking
Fluently add and subtract within 20 using multiple strategies.
Number & Operations in Base Ten
Develop place-value reasoning to 120.
Measurement & Data
Measure, tell time, and analyze data from real contexts.
Geometry
Describe and compose shapes, partitioning them into equal shares.
Counting Forward Warm-Up
Count forward within 20 and match quantities to numerals.
Count aloud from any number within 20.
Match sets to the correct numeral.
What number comes after 14?
Hum the counting song and go one more.
Tap the number line to count on.
Choose the picture that shows 9 objects.

Touch and count each apple once.
Drag counters into the ten-frame.
Write the number for this set of 12 dots.
Group the dots into ten and some ones.
Trace over the numeral card for 12.
Chant the counting sequence using movement.
Check numerals by sky-writing with a finger.
Toggle the number line overlay for visual cues.

masteryRule.notes: Unlocks Counting Explorer badge.

translations.en: Skip Counting Detective
Use skip counting and comparison language to solve puzzles.
Skip count by twos within 40.
Explain which set has more using math vocabulary.
You counted 12 shells by twos. What number comes next?
Add two more shells to your picture.
Use the skip-count number line to hop by twos.
Which set is greater: üê†üê†üê†üê†üê† or üê†üê†üê†üê†?
Five fish
Four fish
They are the same
Line up each fish to compare.
Slide each fish into a ten-frame to check.
Pick the statement that is true.
18 is less than 16
20 is greater than 18
16 equals 14
Compare the tens and ones.
Show each number on the number line.
Explain your reasoning aloud using math language.
Enable visual cues for skip-count hops.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge mastery triggers enrichment playlist.

translations.en: Compare with Ten-Frames
Use ten-frames and math talk to compare groups within 10.
Match each object to a ten-frame box when comparing.
Use the words greater, less, or equal.
Which symbol shows that 7 is greater than 5?
Say the math sentence aloud: seven is __ than five.
Pair counters to see which row has extras.
Fill in the blank: 6 is ___ 6.
greater than
less than
equal to
Cover each six with a counter.
Use the sentence frame provided.
Choose the ten-frame that shows 8.

Count each filled box.
Play the audio prompt to count together.
Use math talk sentence frames for compare statements.
Provide tactile counters for hands-on pairing.

masteryRule.notes: Reassign after coaching if mastery is not met.

translations.en: Story Problems with Counters
Model joining and separating stories using counters and equations.
Represent stories with concrete objects.
Write an equation that matches the story.
3 birds join 2 birds. How many birds now?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Fill in the blank: 4 + __ = 7
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which equation matches six and four more?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use story mats with pictures to visualize.
Act it out with counters before answering.
Enable audio narration of each story problem.

masteryRule.notes: Marks lesson complete in caregiver report.

translations.en: Equation Puzzlers
Analyze and match equations representing the same story.
Decompose numbers to make new equations.
Explain why two equations show the same situation.
Which equation matches 8 + 2 = 10?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the pair of equations that show the same story.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which equation shows 7 separated into 5 and 2?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Explain the relationship between addends and sums.
Offer turn-and-talk prompts before answering.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge mastery triggers enrichment playlist.

translations.en: Show Me Join or Separate
Use concrete objects and gestures to show joining or separating.
Identify whether a story is join or separate.
Model the story with real objects.
5 blocks joined 3 blocks. Which equation matches?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which sentence shows a separating story?
I had 8 snacks and ate 2.
I found 3 shells and 2 more.
I built a tower with 4 and then 4 more.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the tool that helps show separating.
Take-away mat
Addition song
Skip-count chart
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Act out the story with gestures before picking an equation.
Provide join/separate sorting cards.

masteryRule.notes: Repeat lesson after coaching if mastery not met.

translations.en: Build Teen Numbers
Compose teen numbers using a ten-frame and loose ones.
Represent teen numbers as ten and some ones.
Write matching equations for teen numbers.
What is 10 and 3 more?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the equation for a ten-frame with five extra ones.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which teen number has 1 ten and 8 ones?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Group the counters into one full ten-frame first.
Use the highlight feature to show tens versus ones.

masteryRule.notes: Mastery unlocks teen-number story quest.

translations.en: Teen Equation Match
Match visual models to equivalent teen equations.
Explain how ten and ones make a teen number.
Compare two representations of the same number.
Which equation matches 17 shown as 10 + 7?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the model that also shows 15.
One ten-frame and five loose ones
Two full ten-frames
Five loose ones
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the statement that is true about 19.
It is 1 ten and 9 ones
It is 9 tens and 1 one
It is 10 + 0
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use the sentence frame: I see __ tens and __ ones.
Turn on AR blocks to view tens and ones.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge completion notifies caregivers of mastery.

translations.en: Make a Ten and Some More
Use scaffolded ten-frames to build and decompose teen numbers.
Compose teen numbers with concrete tools.
State how many ones are left after making a ten.
After filling one ten-frame, how many ones are left for 14?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which card shows 13 as a ten and some ones?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the picture that matches 11.
One ten-frame and one loose counter
Two full ten-frames
Only loose counters
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Slide counters into the ten-frame, then count leftovers.
Enable slow-paced audio prompts guiding the build.

masteryRule.notes: Recommend reteach with hands-on kit if not met.

translations.en: Compare Length Stations
Describe and compare object lengths using math language.
Use longer/shorter vocabulary accurately.
Order objects by length.
Which pencil is longer?
Blue pencil
Red pencil
Same length
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the word that describes the heavier rock.
Lighter
Heavier
Equal
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Put these objects in order from shortest to longest.
Crayon, book, jump rope
Jump rope, crayon, book
Book, jump rope, crayon
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Line objects up at the left edge to compare.
Show animated arrows indicating start points.

masteryRule.notes: Sends caregiver tip for comparison games.

translations.en: Sort and Graph Challenge
Classify objects into categories and interpret simple graphs.
Sort objects using two attributes.
Read a picture graph to compare categories.
Which group has more: triangles or circles?
Triangles
Circles
Same
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the graph that matches the sorted buttons.
Graph with three red, two blue
Graph with two red, three blue
Graph with all blue
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
How many more squares than circles were sorted?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Count each category carefully before comparing.
Highlight each bar as it is counted.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge summary sent to teacher dashboard.

translations.en: Sort by One Attribute
Practice sorting objects by a single attribute with prompts.
Identify a sorting rule.
Count how many are in each group.
Which items belong in the round group?
Balls
Books
Crayons
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
How many triangles are in the group?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which sentence tells about the picture graph?
There are more squares than circles
There are more circles than squares
They are the same
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Say the sorting rule aloud together.
Use drag-and-drop prompts with immediate feedback.

masteryRule.notes: If mastery not met, assign caregiver printable.

translations.en: Name That Shape
Identify common 2D and 3D shapes in the environment.
Name shapes regardless of orientation.
Describe shapes using attributes.
Which shape has three sides?
Triangle
Square
Circle
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the 3D shape shaped like a can.
Cylinder
Cone
Sphere
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which shape is round with no corners?
Circle
Square
Triangle
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Trace the shape with your finger to feel the sides.
Show AR overlay of the shape in the room.

masteryRule.notes: Mastery notifies caregivers to go on a shape walk.

translations.en: Compose with Tangrams
Combine simple shapes to build larger figures.
Compose a hexagon from triangles.
Describe the component shapes used.
Which pieces make a hexagon?
Six triangles
Two circles
One rectangle
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the shapes used to build the rocket picture.
Triangles and rectangles
Circles only
Hearts and stars
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the statement that describes the composed shape.
It uses four triangles
It uses circles
It has no straight sides
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Name each small shape before combining.
Show ghost outline of the target shape.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge completion unlocks printable tangram puzzle.

translations.en: Sort Shapes by Features
Sort shapes into groups based on defining attributes.
Sort shapes by number of sides.
Describe why shapes belong in each group.
Which shapes belong with four sides?
Squares
Triangles
Circles
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the shape that rolls easily.
Sphere
Cube
Rectangular prism
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which sentence is true?
A square has 4 equal sides
A triangle has 4 sides
A circle has corners
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Count the sides together before sorting.
Highlight defining attributes with glowing outlines.

masteryRule.notes: Suggest shape hunt if mastery not met.

translations.en: Fact Fluency Strategies
Use make-ten and doubles to solve within 20.
Apply a known strategy to solve a fact.
Explain which strategy was used.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which strategy fits 6 + 6?
Make ten
Double
Count back
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use number bonds to organize your thinking.
Share the strategy name after solving.
Enable animated strategy cards as needed.

masteryRule.notes: Updates fact fluency streak for analytics.

translations.en: Unknown Addend Detective
Solve word problems by finding missing partners in equations.
Represent a missing addend with a symbol.
Check answers using the inverse operation.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which subtraction sentence checks 8 + 6 = 14?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use a bar model to show the whole and the part you know.
Provide equation tiles to drag missing values.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge results sync to mastery dashboard.

translations.en: Strategy Coach
Revisit fact strategies with guided prompts and visuals.
Identify the strategy that fits a given fact.
Use counters or a number line to confirm.
Which strategy helps with 5 + 6?
Double
Make ten
Count back
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
What is 8 + 8?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Solve 12 - 4 using a number line.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Think aloud: what strategy fits best?
Show animated hops on a number line.

masteryRule.notes: If mastery not met, schedule teacher check-in.

translations.en: Place Value Sort
Build and compare two-digit numbers using tens and ones.
Represent numbers with tens and ones.
Compare two-digit numbers using >, =, <.
Which number has 4 tens and 2 ones?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the symbol for 37 __ 45
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which model matches 53?
5 tens and 3 ones
3 tens and 5 ones
4 tens and 13 ones
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Group cubes into rods before comparing.
Explain which place you compared first.
Display interactive base-ten blocks on screen.

masteryRule.notes: Progress appears in caregiver dashboard.

translations.en: Two-Digit Strategy Sprint
Solve addition problems within 100 using place-value reasoning.
Use tens and ones to add without regrouping.
Explain a mental strategy used for adding multiples of ten.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which explanation matches 47 + 30?
Add 3 tens to 4 tens to make 7 tens
Add the ones first and subtract
Multiply the tens
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Break the numbers into tens and ones before solving.
Provide scaffold showing expanded form.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge completion unlocks extra math mission.

translations.en: Tens and Ones Workshop
Strengthen place-value understanding with guided manipulatives.
Bundle ones into tens when counting.
State how many tens and ones are in a number.
How many tens are in 46?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which shows 32?
3 tens and 2 ones
2 tens and 3 ones
1 ten and 12 ones
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Pick the number that comes after 78.
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Bundle and trade ones into tens together.
Enable narrated base-ten animation.

masteryRule.notes: Flag for teacher conference if mastery not met twice.

translations.en: Measure with Units
Use same-size units to measure and compare lengths.
Lay units end to end with no gaps.
Record measurements with a unit label.
How many paperclips long is the pencil?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which statement is true?
The ribbon is longer than the marker
The ribbon is shorter
They are equal
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Put the objects in order from shortest to longest.
Eraser, crayon, notebook
Notebook, eraser, crayon
Crayon, notebook, eraser
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Snap each unit next to the previous without gaps.
Show guided animation aligning measurement units.

masteryRule.notes: Adds to measurement progress bar.

translations.en: Clock Quest
Tell and write time to the hour and half-hour in real contexts.
Read analog clocks to the nearest half hour.
Match analog and digital times.
The clock shows the hour hand on 3 and minute hand on 12. What time is it?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which digital time matches the clock with the minute hand on 6 and hour hand between 7 and 8?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the activity that fits 6:30 PM.
Brush teeth for bed
Eat lunch at school
Morning circle
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Think about where the hour hand points before reading minutes.
Enable audible ticking and verbal prompts.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge completion triggers caregiver evening routine tip.

translations.en: Graph Builder
Collect and organize data with scaffolded charts.
Sort data into categories before graphing.
Describe which category has more or fewer.
How many votes did apples get?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which fruit has the fewest votes?
Bananas
Grapes
Apples
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
How many more students chose apples than grapes?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Point to each tally mark while counting.
Highlight comparison bars when selected.

masteryRule.notes: Assign take-home survey if mastery not met.

translations.en: Shape Attribute Lab
Distinguish defining and non-defining attributes of shapes.
Describe shapes by number of sides and vertices.
Identify non-defining features like color or size.
Which attribute defines a rectangle?
Four right angles
Blue color
Small size
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Select the shape with 3 vertices.
Triangle
Square
Circle
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which sentence is true?
A rhombus has four equal sides
A rectangle must be red
A square has three sides
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Highlight the sides and vertices as you count.
Provide comparison charts showing defining vs non-defining.

masteryRule.notes: Feeds geometry strand progress.

translations.en: Partition Master
Partition circles and rectangles into equal shares and label them.
Partition shapes into halves and fourths.
Name equal shares using halves and fourths.
Which picture shows a circle split into fourths?
Circle with four equal wedges
Circle with three pieces
Circle with uneven pieces
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Choose the sentence that matches the partitioned rectangle.
The rectangle is split into two equal halves
One part is larger
It has five equal parts
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
What fraction name describes one out of four equal parts?
One fourth
One half
One third
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Check that each share matches before naming it.
Enable grid overlay to support equal partitioning.

masteryRule.notes: Challenge mastery unlocks printable fraction games.

translations.en: Equal Shares Basics
Guide students to split shapes into equal parts with scaffolds.
Use fold or draw methods to create equal shares.
State whether shares are equal or unequal.
Does this rectangle show equal halves?
Yes
No
Not sure
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Which picture shows unequal parts?
Circle split evenly
Rectangle with one large and one small part
Square with two equal parts
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
How many equal parts make a half?
Use the manipulatives to think it through.
Turn on support visuals if needed.
Fold virtual paper or use draw tool to split shapes.
Highlight each part as you compare sizes.

masteryRule.notes: Assign caregiver sharing activity if mastery not met.
